newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian electricity demand up 0.1 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Italian electricity demand up 0.1 pct in 1996.

text.p: Italian electricity consumption rose just 0.1 percent in 1996 compared with a three percent rise in 1995, a statement by state electricity group ENEL said on Wednesday.

Electricity demand in the industrial sector fell 1.2 percent, while in the domestic sector it rose one percent, in the service sector it increased 3.1 percent, and in the agricultural sector it was up 2.4 percent, it added.
In 1995, industrial use climbed 4.5 percent, domestic consumption increased 0.5 percent, the service sector rose 2.4 percent and the agricultural sector fell 3.3 percent.

The 1996 data showed electricity usage up 0.3 percent in the central northern region of Italy and up 2.2 percent in Sardinia. In the central southern region of the country it fell 0.8 percent and in Sicily it dropped 0.5 percent.
